definition: good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: It was sunny when I went out. Who knows why it changed all of a sudden.
sentences.chinese: 出去的時候天還好好兒的，誰知道說變就變了。

sentences.english: Now you've come, you try to do right and be a credit to us.
sentences.chinese: 你現在即來了，就得好好兒幹，讓我們臉上也光彩。

sentences.english: I'll give you two weeks off, so you can have a rest and then come back to work.
sentences.chinese: 我放你兩週的假，你好好兒休息，然後再回來工作。

sentences.english: After your exam, we can have a good celebration.
sentences.chinese: 你考完試，我們好好兒慶祝慶祝。

sentences.english: Give the room a thorough cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 把這房間好好兒打掃一下。

sentences.english: Everything's fine, why don't you take a photo?
sentences.chinese: 好好兒的，你怎麼不拍了？

sentences.english: No more nonsense now. Get dressed and ready for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 再不許胡鬧了，好好兒起來等喫早飯吧。

sentences.english: You need to have a good rest today.
sentences.chinese: 今天你就在家好好兒休息。

sentences.english: Thiink carefully, where did you put the racket in the end?
sentences.chinese: 你好好兒想想，到底把球拍放哪兒了？

sentences.english: You just keep up the good work, all right?
sentences.chinese: 你還要繼續好好兒工作哦。

sentences.english: I intend to stay at home for the whole seven days and have a good rest.
sentences.chinese: 劉靜我啊？就打算在家待七天，好好兒休息休息。

sentences.english: That hundred-year-old tree is still growing well.
sentences.chinese: 那棵百年老樹至今還長得好好兒的。

sentences.english: Me? I intend to stay at home for the whole seven days and have a good rest.
sentences.chinese: 我啊？就打算在家待七天，好好兒休息休息。

sentences.english: Perhaps it was my fault in not training that one properly.
sentences.chinese: 也許是我自己的過錯，沒有好好兒訓練這隻手。
